answers.q: What's the migration strategy for existing rules?
answers.u: Graphiti becomes primary from day 1, rules kept as read-only archive

answers.q: For Claude Code MCP integration, which transport should we use?
answers.a: if you can do what summitflow is already doing (and even leverage the same code or extend it if it makes sense) then please do. be sure though first that this is possible...don't make any assumptions
answers.u: Use REST API via Agent Hub like SummitFlow, not MCP

answers.q: How should we handle the confidence threshold for learnings?
answers.a: what do you recommend? run it by /ask_gemini pro as well
answers.u: Gemini Pro recommended Probabilistic Promotion: provisional at 70+, canonical at 90+ or reinforcement

answers.q: What should happen when both Claude Code AND SummitFlow access Graphiti simultaneously?
answers.u: Single global group_id, all learnings visible to all agents

answers.q: For logging during testing, what level of transparency do you need?
answers.u: Log every Graphiti API call, confidence score, and promotion decision

answers.q: How do you want to test the integration?
answers.a: you've already been doing memory tests with graphiti with agent-hub and summitflow...i want whatever gets us using claude code with graphiti and saving tokens on claude rules ASAP. but only if it will work and not cause major headaches.
answers.u: Fast path - leverage existing integration, get it working ASAP

gemini_consultation.topic: Confidence threshold for AI agent learnings
gemini_consultation.recommendation: Probabilistic Promotion with two-state system (provisional/canonical). Don't ask LLM for float, ask for semantic confidence levels (Verified Execution=0.95, Strong Inference=0.80, Pattern Matching=0.60). Promote on reinforcement (same learning from different session).
